questions.question_text:
A user is given access to a service that gives them access to cloud-hosted physical and virtual servers, storage, and networking.

Which NIST cloud service model is this?

discussion.content:
In serverless apps, the developer uploads only the app package itself, without a full container image
or any OS components. The platform dynamically packages it into an image, runs the image in a
container, and then (if needed) instantiates the underlying host OS and VM and the hardware
required to run them. In a serverless model, users make the most dramatic trade-offs of
compatibility and control for the simplest, most efficient deployment and management experience.
Answer is B from Official Practice test...

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B.
Page 167 of the stufy guide.

Selected Answer: B
The answer is B

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B

questions.question_text: Which characteristic of serverless computing enables developers to quickly deploy application code?

choices.C: Using cloud service spot pricing to reduce the cost of using virtual machines to run their application code
choices.D: Using Container as a Service (CaaS) to deploy application containers to run their code.
choices.A: Uploading cloud service autoscaling services to deploy more virtual machines to run their application code based on user demand
choices.B: Uploading the application code itself, without having to provision a full container image or any OS virtual machine components

choices.A: It acts as a safety net during an attack while patches are developed.
choices.C: It manages applications accessible on endpoints.
choices.B: It secures internal network traffic against unknown threats.
choices.D: It reduces the need for network security.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Cortex XDR provides an additional layer of protection during an attack by detecting and containing threats while patches are developed and applied to correct vulnerabilities.

questions.question_text: Which Palo Alto Networks subscription dynamically discovers and maintains a real-time inventory of devices on your network?
In the Transport layer of the OSI model, what is a protocol data unit (PDU) called?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The PDU of the transport layer is a Datagram or a Segment. Therefore the right answer is C, Datagram. All other options are wrong.

Selected Answer: B
Transport Layer: This layer is responsible for end-to-end data transmission and ensures that data is delivered correctly and in order. It provides services such as flow control, error correction, and quality of service management.
 PDU in the Transport Layer: At the Transport layer, the PDU is called a packet. This packet contains the data sent from the upper layer (such as the Application layer) and adds control information necessary to ensure proper delivery and handling of the data.

 Data Link Layer: In contrast to the Transport layer, the PDU at the Data Link layer is called a frame. This layer is responsible for data transmission over a physical link between two devices on a local network.

 Network Layer: At the Network layer, the PDU is referred to as a datagram. This layer handles routing data between different networks.

In summary, in the OSI model's Transport layer, the term used for the Protocol Data Unit is packet.

Selected Answer: C
I agree, it is C

Selected Answer: C
Answer is C
OSI model Protocol Data Unit stages
Layer 4 - Transport = (TCP) Segment / (UDP) Datagram
Layer 3 - Network = Packet
Layer 2 - Data Link = Frame
Layer 1 - Physical = Bit
